revised_title: A New Hygrometer Made of a Deal Rod
tldr: William Arderon invents a new hygrometer made of a deal rod, which can measure the moisture and dryness of the air. The device is simple, cost-effective, and can be used both on land and at sea. It can also assist in predicting weather changes and is not affected by the expansion and contraction of the deal rod due to heat and cold.
